newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico Bondes rates mixed at auction.
newsitem.headline: Mexico Bondes rates mixed at auction.

text.p: The rate on Mexican government 364-day development bonds, or Bondes, rose 0.14 percentage points to 1.20 percent above the one-month Cetes rate in Tuesday's primary auction, dealers estimated.
The 364-day Bondes were assigned at 98.91104 pesos.
Demand for the one-year Bondes was 1.26 billion pesos, compared with the 500 million offered by the Banco de Mexico.
The rate on the 728-day Bondes, fell 0.08 percentage points to 1.23 percent above the 28-day Cetes rate from 1.31 perecnt last week.
The 728-day Bondes were assigned at 97.96562 pesos.
Demand for the 728-day Bondes was 2.396 billion pesos, compared with the 700 million offered by the Banco de Mexico.
